items.title: VI Live: bekijk het programma in binnen- en buitenland
items.summary: Welkom in de VI Live op deze ijskoude zondag 11 januari. Volg hier de ontwikkelingen binnen en buiten de grenzen, met op deze plek onder meer aandacht voor de Eredivisie, de finale van de Super Cup tussen Barcelona en Real Madrid en het FA Cup-toernooi.

items.title: Legendary Luke bids to enhance his reputation at Fontwell
items.summary: We have jumps action to enjoy from Fontwell on Sunday afternoon, live on Sky Sports Racing...

items.title: Bears complete stunning final-quarter comeback to defeat Packers
items.summary: The Chicago Bears secured their first playoff win in 15 years after a stunning late fightback saw them beat the Green Bay Packers 31-27 and reach the Divisional Round.

items.title: De prof die zijn voetbalbestaan opzij schoof om voor anderen te zorgen
items.summary: Toen zijn zusje met autisme uit huis dreigde te worden geplaatst, gaf Kenzo Biyong (28) zijn voetbalcarri√®re op om voor haar te zorgen. Hij bleek in de zorg n√≥g meer talent te hebben dan in zijn voeten. Toen een zwaar autistische jongen in een crisisopvang dreigde te komen, nam hij hem bij zijn jonge gezin in huis. Het fantaseren over spelen in volle stadions is tegenwoordig vervangen door dromen over een zorgboerderij.

items.title: Lange tegendoelpuntenreeks Feyenoord: Van Persie nadert Van Bronckhorst
items.summary: Aan het begin van het seizoen werd Feyenoord nog zo geroemd om zijn defensie, maar dat is op moment van schrijven wel anders. Liefst acht wedstrijden in de Eredivisie wachten de Rotterdammers al op een clean sheet .

items.title: VI Live: Feyenoord aast op revanche tegen Heerenveen
items.summary: Welkom in deze VI Live met aandacht voor SC Heerenveen - Feyenoord. Om 12.15 uur is de aftrap in het Abe Lenstra Stadion. Via deze VI Live houden we je op de hoogte van het duel in speelronde 18 van de Eredivisie.

items.title: Jans zag de onrust bij Ajax: 'Gevoel dat ze iemand zoals ik nodig hadden'
items.summary: Ron Jans was in zijn trainerscarri√®re actief bij een rijk scala aan clubs, maar coachte nooit een topdrieclub. Dat had hij graag gewild, al doet het niets af aan zijn indrukwekkende loopbaan. De 67-jarige Zwollenaar had het gevoel dat ze bij Ajax iemand zoals hem nodig nadat Maurice Steijn werd ontslagen.

items.title: Rams score in final minute to beat Panthers in NFL playoffs
items.summary: Colby Parkinson's touchdown with 38 seconds to play silenced the Carolina Panthers crowd as the Los Angeles Rams escaped with a 34-31 victory to advance to the Divisional Round of the NFL playoffs on Saturday.

items.title: USMNT's Pepi suffers broken arm scoring for PSV
items.summary: United States striker Ricardo Pepi suffered a broken forearm while in action for PSV Eindhoven on Saturday and and is set to be sidelined for two months, the Dutch club has confirmed..

items.title: Buoyant Rosenior lauds 5-star Chelsea start
items.summary: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior promised more to come from his second string after they swept aside Charlton 5-1 at the Valley in his first match in charge.

items.title: Fletcher 'prepared' to lead Man Utd until summer
items.summary: Darren Fletcher has said he's "prepared" if Manchester United decide to hand him the head coach job until the end of the season.

items.title: Salah scores to set up AFCON reunion with Man√©
items.summary: Mohamed Salah scored his fourth goal of the Africa Cup of Nations as Egypt defeated defending champions Ivory Coast 3-2 in Agadir.

items.title: Supercopa Clasico preview, predictions: Are Barcelona favorites vs. Real Madrid?
items.summary: Barcelona and Real Madrid meet in the Supercopa final Sunday, but who has the upper hand? Sam Marsden and Alex Kirkland preview the upcoming Clasico.

items.title: Why Rosenior sees no need for drastic change at Chelsea
items.summary: Liam Rosenior does not see a need for drastic change at Chelsea - and that was part of the reason he was brought in.

items.title: 'Give me the world title fight' - Kabayel wants Usyk after beating Knyba
items.summary: Agit Kabayel stopped Damian Knyba in the third round to retain his WBC interim heavyweight title as the unbeaten fighter set his sights on Oleksandr Usyk.

items.title: Another door closes for Spurs and Frank with damaging FA Cup exit
items.summary: After Spurs' damaging FA Cup exit at home to Aston Villa, chief football writer Phil McNulty asks how long can head coach Thomas Frank survive?

items.title: Chelsea thrash Charlton to get Liam Rosenior era off to winning start
items.summary: It sums up the uneasy state of affairs at Chelsea that the new head coach winning his first match in charge was not enough to stop the mutiny. This was a controlled, clinical performance from Liam Rosenior‚Äôs second string, who strolled into the fourth round of the FA Cup after a 5-1 win over a game but limited Charlton Athletic, but once again the big talking point was the travelling support spewing venom in the direction of their unpopular owners. Dissatisfaction with the project is not going away. It did not even matter when Rosenior looked at his bench with Chelsea 3-1 up in the second half and decided to give Estev√£o Willian a runout against tired, lowly Championship opposition. The Brazilian winger is one of the best young players in the world and his runs were soon making Charlton‚Äôs defenders dizzy, but even signings like Est√™v√£o have done little to sway the view of a fanbase united in opposition to an ownership almost four years in and still to convince naysayers that their unique vision will bring success. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Outstanding' - Rosenior delighted with debut after Chelsea thrash Charlton
items.summary: Liam Rosenior won his first game as Chelsea's new head coach, beating Charlton 5-1 in the FA Cup third round.

items.title: Frank's failing Spurs knocked out of FA Cup by Aston Villa
items.summary: Goals from Emiliano Buendia and Morgan Rogers knock a wasteful Tottenham Hotspur side out of the FA Cup to pile more pressure on manager Thomas Frank.

items.title: Buend√≠a deepens gloom for Frank and Spurs as Aston Villa progress in FA Cup
items.summary: This was Tottenham‚Äôs second defeat to Aston Villa this season and it is becoming increasingly hard to imagine Thomas Frank being in charge when the teams come together a third time in May. A performance that put an end to any realistic chance of a trophy fell well below the expectations of a furious crowd. That their opponents currently offer the diametric opposite of Tottenham‚Äôs dysfunction can only have heightened the sting. Goals from Emi Buend√≠a and Morgan Rogers put this tie to bed for Villa in the first half, Wilson Odobert‚Äôs strike after half-time bringing a closeness to the scoreline that was not reflected in the general play. A scuffle on the field at the final whistle involving Rogers, Jo√£o Palhinha and a host of Tottenham players only added further sourness to the occasion. Continue reading...
